captions.text: Welcome to the League of Legends Champion Spotlight featuring Syndra, the Dark Sovereign.
Syndra is a ranged mage who focuses on creating and manipulating Dark Spheres to damage and disrupt her foes.
When played to perfection, Syndra can take out her enemies without even taking damage back.
Syndra’s passive is Transcendent. All of Syndra’s basic abilities gain a unique bonus at rank 5.
Dark Sphere damages enemies in a small area and creates a Dark Sphere that remains for a few seconds.
At rank 5, Transcendent causes Dark Sphere to deal bonus damage to champions.
As Syndra’s primary damage tool, I recommend maxing Dark Sphere as soon as possible.
Force of Will first picks up one of Syndra’s Dark Spheres, an enemy minion, or a neutral monster.
For the next few seconds, Syndra can re-activate Force of Will to toss her victim, damaging and slowing all enemies where it lands.
At rank 5, Transcendent increases Force of Will’s slow duration.
For increased damage and slowing, Force of Will is a must-have by early levels and is worth maxing second.
Scatter the Weak damages and knocks back all enemies in a cone.
Syndra’s Dark Spheres are also knocked back, damaging and stunning enemies they hit.
At rank 5, Transcendent increases the width of the cone, allowing Scatter the Weak to hit more targets.
For its great utility, take a point in Scatter the Weak early. However, I recommend leaving it at one point and maxing it last.
Unleashed Power is Syndra’s Ultimate. Unleashed Power collects up all nearby Dark Spheres and fires them at target enemy champion, dealing damage with each one.
While Syndra always has three Dark Spheres orbiting her, using Dark Sphere multiple times before using Unleashed Power will increase its damage output.
As with all ultimates, I recommend maxing Unleashed Power as quickly as possible.
In early laning, use your Dark Spheres and Force of Will to whittle down your opponents.
If you cast them whenever your opponent attacks minions, you’ll ensure he can’t dodge them.
As Xerath tries to last hit at his turret, Syndra is able to constantly drop his health.
Soon after, Syndra pushes in with Dark Spheres, Ignite, and basic attacks, dealing just enough damage to drop his health and get away if it weren’t for Evelynn.
Syndra’s level 6 burst is exceptionally high. While trading blows with Xerath, Evelynn comes in to gank.
Syndra first casts a Dark Sphere before using Unleashed Power, hitting with four spheres to pick up the kill.
Remember that Dark Sphere enables all of Syndra’s other abilities.
As Syndra comes to assist in a fight, Dark Sphere enables Force of Will to slow Evelynn, picking up a quick kill.
Turning back, the enemy Blitzcrank is chasing Rengar, so Syndra drops a Dark Sphere over the wall for Scatter the Weak, stunning Blitzcrank and allowing Rengar to escape.
If not for Flash, Force of Will would have allowed Syndra a second kill.
When fighting one on one, get a Dark Sphere out and lead with Force of Will. The slow makes it easy to land Scatter the Weak for a stun, leading to another Dark Sphere.
An immediate use of Unleashed Power and Ignite drops Xerath extremely low, allowing Syndra to Flash for the kill with Dark Sphere.
In team fights, there are three goals: Stay safe, create as much disruption as possible, and save Unleashed Power for squishy targets with multiple nearby Dark Spheres.
After taking down Rengar with standard abilities, Syndra turns to fight the enemies coming from the left.
Force of Will slows down Blitzcrank before Unleashed Power deals immense damage to Evelynn, picking up another kill.
Turning back to Blitzcrank, Dark Sphere into Force of Will sets up an easy stun with Scatter the Weak, making the chase an easy one as the rest of Syndra’s team focuses down to pick up the kill.
In one final fight, Dark Sphere into Scatter the Weak initiates onto Blitzcrank.
An immediate Force of Will slows him down, but a premature Unleashed Power should have been saved for later.
As Blitzcrank chases down, Force of Will and Dark Sphere keep him away and set up an easy stun with Scatter the Weak.
The stun makes Dark Sphere easy to land to grab the kill. Syndra runs over as two more kills are cleaned up before her attention is turned to Jayce.
Though far away, Dark Sphere into Scatter the Weak locks him up, enabling Syndra’s second kill through Force of Will.
I recommend building Syndra with a primary emphasis on Ability Power for damage output, with a few considerations for utility and durability.
Try Magic Penetration Marks, Mana Regeneration Seals, Magic Resist Glyphs, and Ability Power Quintessences.
Consider 21/0/9 Masteries, focusing on Magic Damage in Offense plus Mana Regeneration and Neutral Buff Duration in Utility.
I recommend Ignite and Flash for Summoner Spells for damage output and maneuverability.
For items, try opening with Boots of Speed, Health Potions, and an early Chalice of Harmony.
Add Sorcerer’s Shoes and rush for Rabadon’s Death cap.
Because of Syndra’s low cooldowns, Rylai’s Crystal Scepter will add a lot of utility before adding more damage through Void Staff and Athene’s Unholy Grail.
Finally adding Zhonya’s Hourglass will help you survive when focused in fights while adding even more Ability Power.
Thanks for tuning into the Syndra Champion Spotlight. Please subscribe to the Riot Games YouTube channel above and leave us your comments just below the video!

comments.text:
Just tried her on free rotation. Wow... her damage per ability is quite 
high, but her mana consumption is exceedingly high. Couple that with the 
complexity of her abilities and requiring a combo to deal sufficient damage 
and i can certainly see Riot dropping the ball on this one. Cooldown on 
Dark Sphere is too high, mana cost per ability is too high and the Dark 
Spheres are not present long enough at 6 seconds. After spending an hour 
playing around with her, i am certain i will never buy her.

Nice concept on paper, but quite frankly, the difficulty is too high to 
make her fun.﻿

comments.author: Erik Berndt

comments.text:
+Erik Berndt I agree, I find that Syndra is very good in mid game team 
fights as well due to her crowd control and AOE abilities (which is all of 
them lol) with a little coordination from your teammates, or at least 
without them doing anything that would completely make you ineffective 
(i.e. them running off on their own, their team splits up into two groups, 
a dps group and a zoning group to target and chase your teammate down and 
you not being able to help them due to the fact that your zoned, well 
hopefully you understand Syndra well enough that you can counter zone them 
but sometimes it's too risky) then you can make huge trade offs in a team 
fight to your advantage without you or your teammates even losing too many 
lives or even much health.
Now if Syndra is alone then with enough caution and understanding of her 
strengths and weaknesses then you can usually escape a gank or even 
completely turn that gank around.
comments.author: Natsu Dragneel

comments.text:
+Araya Napolitano False. No mana means you're screwed, but multichampions 
is easy. Drop a ball or two as you run and then e. You've just gotta be 
smart about it.
comments.author: Erik Berndt

comments.text:
I main Syndra and my biggest problem was definitely mana as her mana 
consumption is pretty high. But, I realized that if you leave the in-lane 
poking to auto-attacking and dropping a dark sphere only if you're 
confident you won't miss, you'll be able to maintain a good amount of mana 
and keep your opponent at considerably low health. The only major issue 
with Syndra is her extreme immobility. If you can use Force of Will to slow 
your pursuer, Scatter the Weak's stun is easy to land, making for a good 
getaway. Unfortunately, when being chased by multiple champions or having 
no mana, the escape can be pretty difficult, if not impossible without the 
assistance of an ally.
comments.author: Araya Napolitano

she scales very well too. The more you play her and understand her

comments.text: super fun, amiright?
comments.author: Erik Berndt

comments.text:
I agree that she can be difficult to play (even though she has high damage 
potential, she's just like Draven), but it's not hard to learn or master 
her. For the cooldowns and mana, that's why you want to "usually" start 
with Athene's or Tear + Morello. 

She's actually really fun to play imo, more than left-click champions like 
Yi or Tristana. When you get used to her abilities and combos you'll be 
killing full health squishies with 6 spheres ult goddamn easily.

(If you give her another try, try this combo: start spamming Q. When the 
first sphere almost disappears, use your W on it. Then, spawn another Q. 
You might have 3 spheres by that moment. Then throw your W at the enemy and 
your E, then ult and ignite. That's the combo I like to do, and if the 
enemy doesn't know what Syndra does and doesn't run away, it's a guaranteed 
kill.)

gotta have the balls!!!!
comments.author: joaohirasawaa

comments.text:
Syndra is my main. It takes a bit to learn her, but I've found some nice 
things in her: Rush morellonomicon asap, and if you have morellonomicon 
before 10 minutes in, you can do a nice job of bursting. Then, go for Void 
Staff, and if you're having a bit of trouble, try a Zhoniya's or GA. If you 
aren't having problems, go straight into rabadons and follow up with 
deathfires. You're basically op by that point. You want to max dark spheres 
as soon as possible, and her scatter the weak is actually more important 
than her force of will. A nice support is always good to have, too.
comments.author: Erik Berndt

comments.text:
I bought Syndra the other day and I fell in love with her. I tried her out 
in bots and I was like wtf how do I do this, even after watching this 
spotlight. Then I got her thrown to me in ARAM, first time pvp with her and 
went 13 and 12 which is damn good to me. Now she's not even difficult to 
play.
comments.author: Josh King

comments.text:
READ THIS ABOUT A LITTLE SYNDRA GUIDE!
Well, I am gonna be honest to you... She is really simple to me, you just 
need to know where to put your orbs/Q , and just position around it. If you 
cant to that use to position the orb itself with W and throw it if possible 
in front or on a enemy. After that, use E to stun the enemy and do another 
Q on him. After all of that use R and you get a kill if all of that is used 
properly. Also there is a combo where you first stun the enemy and then 
throw the W  (Q-E-W-Q-R). Syndra is one of the best 1v1 midders in a fight 
in my choice, just to know how to use her spells properly.
